node.title: What if everything we think we know about the origins of the Omicron variant is wrong?
node.alt: A woman wearing black rimmed glasses and a disposable face mask sits in her seat on a plane
node.description: When two flights from South Africa landed in Amsterdam last week, authorities scrambled to prevent the import of a new COVID-19 variant. But Omicron has already been lurking in the Netherlands for days.
node.content:
["As Paula Zimmerman queued at her gate in Cape Town, a news alert\u00a0flashed up on her phone, warning about a new variant\u00a0of COVID-19\u00a0that had just been\u00a0discovered in South Africa.", "She wasn't overly concerned and some of her fellow passengers seemed even less fazed.", "\"I said to my husband, 'Oh, it's good that we're going back now because apparently something's going to happen around here',\" she told the ABC.", "\"I remember being a little bit frustrated \u2026\u00a0because a lot of people in our queue weren't complying to the 2-metre rule and weren't wearing a face mask.\"", "By the time Ms Zimmerman's flight and another from Johannesburg landed in Amsterdam, the variant was the subject of urgent talks at the World Health Organisation (WHO).", "Omicron was later declared a variant of concern.", "Those on board had no idea they were about to descend into a new world.", "Passengers were greeted by health officials at Schiphol Airport with fear, hazmat suits and hours of indecision.\u00a0", "They were forced to sit in stationary planes for four hours while Dutch authorities decided how they should process them, believing they could be infected with the new variant, known then as B.1.1.529.", "Across the tarmac on the flight from Johannesburg, Stephanie Nolen, a global health reporter for the New York Times, was aghast.\u00a0", "Eventually, the passengers from both flights were allowed off for PCR testing. But that wasn't the end of their troubles.", "They were then moved into an unventilated room while they waited for their results.\u00a0", "In all, 62 people from the cohort of 624 passengers tested positive for COVID-19 \u2014 one in 10.", "Since then, 18\u00a0passengers have been confirmed to have the Omicron variant. All of them were vaccinated.", "", "
Passengers from two flights out of South Africa were forced to wait for hours at the Schiphol airport while waiting for test results to come back.(Supplied: Paula Zimmerman)
", "Having breathed the same air on the plane and in the testing area, Ms Zimmerman was expecting the worst.", "\"I had been close to a lot of people who tested positive that day,\" she said.", "But after being tested, sent home to isolate, and then retested, she received the all clear.", "Everyone else who initially tested negative, despite having just spent hours in stuffy cabins and waiting rooms with dozens of infected people, was free to go.\u00a0", "While those remaining in the Netherlands had to isolate, others took connecting flights to different corners of the globe, potentially carrying with them a burgeoning Omicron infection in its early stages.", "
Omicron's uncertain origins in Europe
", "Since Delta emerged late last year and became the dominant strain\u00a0around the world, there were always fears that a worse variant would follow.\u00a0", "With little information initially available about Omicron, many nations, including Australia, restricted arrivals from southern Africa, where the variant was first observed.", "The snap decision angered leaders on the continent and health officials abroad.", "Dr Mike Ryan, the WHO's head of emergencies, said South Africa shouldn't have been punished for raising the alarm", "\"They had the systems to pick this up and most importantly, they were truly transparent in sharing this information with the rest of the world,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"I wish we had that behaviour from every country on this planet.\"", "Dutch health officials have now confirmed\u00a0that Omicron was detected in the country in \"two test samples that were taken on November 19 and November 23\".", "That means the variant was already in the Netherlands by the time it was reported to the WHO on November 24.\u00a0", "While the WHO says the first confirmed Omicron infection came from a sample collected in South Africa on November 9, the variant's true origins remain a mystery.", "\"That doesn't mean that it began in South Africa. Not at all,\" Dr Ryan said.", "The WHO's technical lead Dr Maria Van Kerhove, said that as more countries analyse their older samples, the \"timeline may change\".\u00a0", "\"There are a lot of [samples] that haven't yet been sequenced from November in many parts of the world,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"So some of the earliest cases of this particular variant may very well not be in South Africa.\"", "Botswana's Government now says it has found the Omicron variant in samples taken from four diplomats on November 11.\u00a0", "It hasn't specified from which country they came, but the Government says they'd been some in Europe before entering Botswana on November 7.", "Professor Frits Rosendaal, an epidemiologist at Leiden University Medical Centre also said he expected older cases to continue showing up.", "\"If you don't look, you can't find it. Now people are looking and going back [to] old samples and they will know very quickly,\" Professor Rosendaal said.", "There are also signs the variant was circulating in the UK earlier than initially thought.", "", "
A concert in Glasgow held by the iconic and beloved band, Steps has been identified as the source of several Omicron cases in Scotland.\u00a0(Reuters)
", "At least six Omicron cases have been linked to a November 22 concert in Glasgow, featuring 90s pop group Steps.", "Nine other cases are linked to a private event held on November 20.", "Professor Mads Albertsen, a genomic sequencing expert from Aalborg University in Denmark, said many\u00a0countries that have found no cases of Omicron probably\u00a0haven't looked hard enough.\u00a0", "Professor Albertsen said he saw the same pattern when earlier variants emerged.", "\"Countries that sequenced and analysed samples found it,\" he said.", "\"The rest didn't.\"\u00a0", "
Controlling a variant is a race against time
", "Omicron had already\u00a0been identified in 40\u00a0countries as of December 5,\u00a0with the WHO expecting that number to grow.", "While all viruses naturally mutate over time, and sometimes become\u00a0less dangerous in the process, experts around the world believe Omicron's mutations have the potential to make existing vaccines less effective.", "It's likely to be several weeks before we know for sure.", "Omicron's sheer number of mutations\u00a0might have triggered alarm bells, but the WHO says\u00a0there's no\u00a0hard evidence yet that\u00a0the new variant will cause more severe symptoms\u00a0and death than other strains.", "\"Just because we have a new variant doesn't mean the situation is going to get worse,\" Dr Ryan said.", "\"It means we have more uncertainty now, and dealing with uncertainty is difficult.\"", "Denmark is one of the world leaders in genomic sequencing and has so far identified at least 13 cases.", "Professor Albertsen said rapid sequencing allowed authorities to identify Omicron within days, isolate cases and begin contact tracing as soon as possible.", "He said scientist need more time to understand the \"scary\" looking mutations of the Omicron variant, and that \"every day counts\".\u00a0", "\"We are now trying to slow the spread down in Denmark until we know what we don't know yet,\" Professor Albertsen said.", "\"We need a few more weeks to have a better grasp of that.\"", "
Already struggling with Delta, Europe faces a new threat
", "The Netherlands is already struggling\u00a0to bring the latest wave of COVID-19 infections under control. Its\u00a0rate of new cases has surpassed 20,000 per day in the past week.", "", "
The Netherlands has returned to a nighttime curfew.(Reuters: Piroschka Van De Wouw)
", "In the last week of November, an average of 300 COVID-19 patients were admitted to hospital each day \u2014 52 of them to intensive care units. That figure has been steadily climbing since October.", "Health care workers have warned that, since the beginning of November, hospitals were\u00a0not coping with the influx, and feared the system could teeter into a \"code black\" scenario, where there were no intensive care beds free.", "\"We're calling off people who need surgery for hip replacement or heart surgery or cancer treatment.\"", "In response, the Government has introduced tougher restrictions \u2014 including a 5pm to 5am curfew \u2014 as well as more stringent social distancing.\u00a0", "\"I do hope that people start realising that it's necessary.\u00a0Otherwise, the Government needs to enforce this. You have to make sure that measures are followed,\" Professor\u00a0Rosendaal said.", "Now contending with a mysterious new variant, The Netherlands, like many other countries, has imposed travel restrictions on arrivals from countries reporting high rates of Omicron.", "\"Closing borders doesn't really stop a virus. It will slow it down a bit,\" Dr Rosendaal said.", "\"Stopping all travel will definitely have some effect. But if people travel \u2014 and people will travel \u2014 then viruses will spread.\"", "", "
Mads Albertsen runs a genomic sequencing lab in Denmark.(Reuters: Dylan Martinez/File)
", "The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) believes Omicron could account for more than half the continent's cases within a few months.", "If it does overtake Delta, Professor Rosendaal said there could be advantages if it produces milder symptoms.", "However, even if that is the case with Omicron, it would take some time before the world sees the benefits.\u00a0", "\"Even if it's more contagious and has a slightly lower mortality risk, or risk of making people severely ill \u2026\u00a0in the short term, there would be more people in the hospital, there would be more people dying,\" Dr Rosendaal said.", "\"It's only at the end that a thing like that would be good.\"", "Professor Rosendaal says in the meantime, the international community needs to cooperate to reduce transmission and the risk of mutation that comes with it.", "\"As long as we have the virus raging in many places in the world \u2026\u00a0a global approach is necessary,\" he said", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
